item.title: [easy] auto clicker [easy]
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Freddy1990, post:2, topic:77762”]Hmm, I wouldn’t know why you’d want that, but ok, you’ll have ur reasons…
Here’s a simple example:

[code]program AutoClicker;

const
Interval = 1000;

begin
repeat
ClickMouse(397, 298);
Wait(1000);
until False;
end.[/code]
For runescape this would be reather detectable, but it does the job, use Interval to set the time between the clicks (1000 = 1 second)
If you’re going to use it for runescape I’d recommend using another clicking function though, but more humanlike…[/quote]

No matter what the interval is it will always wait 1 second, and it won’t compile. :rolleyes:

[code]program AutoClicker;

const
Interval = 1000;

begin
repeat
ClickMouse(397, 298, True); // have False for right-click
Wait(Interval);
until False;
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [easy] auto clicker [easy]
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Hmm, I wouldn’t know why you’d want that, but ok, you’ll have ur reasons…
Here’s a simple example:

[code]program AutoClicker;

const
Interval = 1000;

begin
repeat
ClickMouse(397, 298);
Wait(1000);
until False;
end.[/code]
For runescape this would be reather detectable, but it does the job, use Interval to set the time between the clicks (1000 = 1 second)
If you’re going to use it for runescape I’d recommend using another clicking function though, but more humanlike…
